fields.description: *Assessment* After successfully configuring multiple regions in Eucalyptus per EUCA-10442, when attempting to view resources (e.g. using euca-describe-availability-zones -U ) from the region that didn't generate the credentials of the user, NPE is returned. {code} # euca-describe-regions REGION region-1 http://compute.g-05-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ REGION region-2 http://compute.a-17.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ ## Source credentials originate from region-2 # cat eucarc | grep compute export EC2_URL=http://compute.a-17.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ ## Attempt to describe the availability zones of region-1 # euca-describe-availability-zones -U http://compute.g-05-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773 euca-describe-availability-zones: error (403 Forbidden): java.lang.NullPointerException {code} *Signs* * DescribeAvailabilityZones with debug output {code} # euca-describe-availability-zones -U http://compute.g-05-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773 --debug 2015-06-14 18:31:19,034 DEBUG DescribeAvailabilityZones parsed arguments: {'filters': None, 'security_token': None, 'url': 'http://compute.g-05-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773', 'region': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None, 'ZoneName': []} 2015-06-14 18:31:19,034 INFO Config finding global option default-region 2015-06-14 18:31:19,034 INFO Config novalue for default-region 2015-06-14 18:31:19,034 INFO Config finding global option max-retries 2015-06-14 18:31:19,034 INFO Config novalue for max-retries 2015-06-14 18:31:19,034 INFO Config finding global option timeout 2015-06-14 18:31:19,034 INFO Config novalue for timeout 2015-06-14 18:31:19,035 WARNING EC2 added fake region name undefined-19055 2015-06-14 18:31:19,035 INFO DescribeAvailabilityZones parameters: {'Action': 'DescribeAvailabilityZones', 'Version': '2014-06-15'} 2015-06-14 18:31:19,035 DEBUG DescribeAvailabilityZones sending flattened params as form data 2015-06-14 18:31:19,038 INFO EC2 sending request (attempt 1 of 3) 2015-06-14 18:31:19,050 DEBUG HmacV4Auth payload hash: b9e5b7fd0a759e5ae3e30e01abd845b078c180babd882526042962647a363bfd 2015-06-14 18:31:19,050 DEBUG HmacV4Auth scope: 20150615/undefined-19055/ec2/aws4_request 2015-06-14 18:31:19,051 DEBUG HmacV4Auth canonical URI: / 2015-06-14 18:31:19,051 DEBUG HmacV4Auth canonical query: 2015-06-14 18:31:19,051 DEBUG HmacV4Auth canonical headers: [u'content-length:51', 'content-type:application/x-www-form-urlencoded', 'host:compute.g-05-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773', 'x-amz-content-sha256:b9e5b7fd0a759e5ae3e30e01abd845b078c180babd882526042962647a363bfd', 'x-amz-date:20150615T013119Z'] 2015-06-14 18:31:19,051 DEBUG HmacV4Auth signed headers: content-length;content-type;host;x-amz-content-sha256;x-amz-date 2015-06-14 18:31:19,051 DEBUG HmacV4Auth canonical request: u'POST\n/\n\ncontent-length:51\ncontent-type:application/x-www-form-urlencoded\nhost:compute.g-05-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773\nx-amz-content-sha256:b9e5b7fd0a759e5ae3e30e01abd845b078c180babd882526042962647a363bfd\nx-amz-date:20150615T013119Z\n\ncontent-length;content-type;host;x-amz-content-sha256;x-amz-date\nb9e5b7fd0a759e5ae3e30e01abd845b078c180babd882526042962647a363bfd' 2015-06-14 18:31:19,051 DEBUG HmacV4Auth string to sign: 'AWS4-HMAC-SHA256\n20150615T013119Z\n20150615/undefined-19055/ec2/aws4_request\n3bfd17d43292a31f0c3751a23419aaec44cf55f0847a7699efd4c228568154f7' 2015-06-14 18:31:19,052 DEBUG HmacV4Auth signature: fe129f969a30720d645d22713651ec4971f42d936cf6349367e6fe70ede178b1 2015-06-14 18:31:19,052 DEBUG HmacV4Auth signed headers: content-length;content-type;host;x-amz-content-sha256;x-amz-date 2015-06-14 18:31:19,052 DEBUG EC2 request method: POST 2015-06-14 18:31:19,052 DEBUG EC2 request url: http://compute.g-05-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ 2015-06-14 18:31:19,052 DEBUG EC2 request header: Authorization: AWS4-HMAC-SHA256 Credential=AKIAATDG2X5GAK73X2WY/20150615/undefined-19055/ec2/aws4_request, SignedHeaders=content-length;content-type;host;x-amz-content-sha256;x-amz-date, Signature=fe129f969a30720d645d22713651ec4971f42d936cf6349367e6fe70ede178b1 2015-06-14 18:31:19,052 DEBUG EC2 request header: Content-Length: 51 2015-06-14 18:31:19,052 DEBUG EC2 request header: Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded 2015-06-14 18:31:19,052 DEBUG EC2 request header: Host: compute.g-05-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773 2015-06-14 18:31:19,052 DEBUG EC2 request header: User-Agent: euca2ools/3.2.0-41-g241e329 (CPython 2.6.6; Linux 2.6.32-504.16.2.el6.x86_64; x86_64) requestbuilder/0.3.0-pre2 requests/1.1.0 2015-06-14 18:31:19,052 DEBUG EC2 request header: X-Amz-Content-SHA256: b9e5b7fd0a759e5ae3e30e01abd845b078c180babd882526042962647a363bfd 2015-06-14 18:31:19,052 DEBUG EC2 request header: X-Amz-Date: 20150615T013119Z 2015-06-14 18:31:19,052 DEBUG EC2 request data: Action: DescribeAvailabilityZones 2015-06-14 18:31:19,052 DEBUG EC2 request data: Version: 2014-06-15 2015-06-14 18:31:19,072 DEBUG EC2 response time: 0.019 seconds 2015-06-14 18:31:19,072 ERROR EC2 response status: 403 2015-06-14 18:31:19,072 DEBUG EC2 response header: connection: close 2015-06-14 18:31:19,072 DEBUG EC2 response header: content-length: 202 2015-06-14 18:31:19,072 DEBUG EC2 response header: content-type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8 2015-06-14 18:31:19,073 DEBUG DescribeAvailabilityZones -- response content -- 403 Forbiddenjava.lang.NullPointerExceptionjava.lang.NullPointerException 2015-06-14 18:31:19,074 DEBUG DescribeAvailabilityZones -- end of response content -- 2015-06-14 18:31:19,074 INFO DescribeAvailabilityZones result: failure euca-describe-availability-zones: error (403 Forbidden): java.lang.NullPointerException Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/bin/euca-describe-availability-zones", line 6, in euca2ools.commands.ec2.describeavailabilityzones.DescribeAvailabilityZones.run() File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 305, in run cmd.handle_cli_exception(err) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 302, in run result = cmd.main() File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 205, in main response = self.send() File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 276, in send return BaseRequest.send(self) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 171, in send return self.handle_server_error(err) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 158, in send auth=self.auth) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 202, in send_request self.handle_http_error(response) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/commands/ec2/__init__.py", line 64, in handle_http_error raise AWSError(response) euca2ools.exceptions.AWSError: (403, 'Forbidden', '403 Forbidden', 'java.lang.NullPointerException') {code} * Region configuration added to ticket
fields.summary: NPE returned when using DescribeAvailabilityZones against region

comments.body:
[~sjones],

Information that you requested.  In order to get any meaningful information, I had to set the log level to TRACE on for each cloud.  The only file that contained any information was the cloud-exhaust log.

*region-1*
{code}
[root@g-22-07 ~]# euca-describe-properties region
PROPERTY	region.region_configuration	{
    "Regions": [
        {
            "Name": "region-1",
            "CertificateFingerprintDigest": "SHA-256",
            "CertificateFingerprint": "7C:60:18:7E:92:FF:3E:C9:32:4F:28:13:C7:91:54:E6:17:7A:E1:AD:01:B3:3F:C7:71:FE:88:FF:34:1A:6F:6D",
            "IdentifierPartitions": [
                1
            ],
            "Services": [
                {
                    "Type": "identity",
                    "Endpoints": [
                        "http://10.111.1.173:8773/services/Identity"
                    ]
                },
                {
                    "Type": "compute",
                    "Endpoints": [
                        "http://compute.g-05-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/"
                    ]
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "Name": "region-2",
            "CertificateFingerprintDigest": "SHA-256",
            "CertificateFingerprint": "B3:70:8B:35:BE:B2:06:69:E9:6A:4C:53:0D:34:30:A4:82:2A:A5:69:96:80:6F:FC:E8:0C:7A:74:8D:F6:DD:3A",
            "IdentifierPartitions": [
                2
            ],
            "Services": [
                {
                    "Type": "identity",
                    "Endpoints": [
                        "http://10.111.5.59:8773/services/Identity"
                    ]
                },
                {
                    "Type": "compute",
                    "Endpoints": [
                        "http://compute.a-17.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/"
                    ]
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
}
PROPERTY	region.region_enable_ssl	true
PROPERTY	region.region_name	region-1
PROPERTY	region.region_ssl_ciphers	RSA:DSS:ECDSA:TLS_EMPTY_RENEGOTIATION_INFO_SCSV:!NULL:!EXPORT:!EXPORT1024:!MD5:!DES
PROPERTY	region.region_ssl_default_cas	true
PROPERTY	region.region_ssl_protocols	TLSv1.2
PROPERTY	region.region_ssl_verify_hostnames	false
{code}
* relevant log information on UFS for region-1
{code}

{code}

REGION	region-1	http://compute.g-05-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	region-2	http://compute.a-17.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/

AVAILABILITYZONE	one	available

[~hspencer], thanks, I have now reproduced the issue. It looks like the problem is that both clouds are configured to be the same region. Updating the region 2 cloud to use region-2 as the "region.region_name" should prevent the issue.

We should be able to return a better error when this occurs, but it will not be great as each region only has visibility of its own configuration.
The error response for use of an unknown access key now has the message "Failed to find access key"
The issue actually occurred for any unknown access key, it was not specific to using federated regions.

[~sjones],

Ah, sorry about that.  That was a copy/paste error on my part.  I guess that was an unexpected find. :-D.  

With regards to the issue I am still seeing now, is there any additional information that you need from me?  The machines are still up if you want to access them and check them out.  

* region-1 CLC - 10.111.1.119
* region-2 CLC - 10.111.1.118

Log in on both is root/foobar.  The eucarc should be under /root/.
[~hspencer], no, the issue is now fixed. If you see that issue it means the access key is not known.
K.  I kill those clouds and retry again.   I will keep you posted.
